title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
summary: Aluminum prices dropped to a one-month low of $2,526 per ton on the London Metal Exchange amid a broader commodity slump. The decline follows stronger US retail sales data and anticipation of the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision. Despite short-term weakness, Commerzbank forecasts aluminum prices to rise to $2,800 a ton in the second half of 2025 due to expected production slowdowns and emission reduction requirements in China.

title: Aluminum Rebounds from 1-Month Low
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rebounded above $2,850 per tonne after hitting a near one-month low of $2,790. The recovery was driven by favorable macroeconomic conditions and supportive comments from Federal Reserve officials, which boosted manufacturing activity and base metals demand.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The US physical aluminum market is experiencing record-high premiums due to steep import tariffs and supply shortages. The Midwest Premium reached a record 88.10 cents per pound, pushing spot market prices to about $4,792 per ton when combined with the benchmark price. Tariffs imposed by the Trump administration have significantly impacted costs and availability, while China's production limits and export dynamics continue to influence global supply.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa reported that despite $69 million in additional costs from US tariffs on Canadian aluminum imports, higher domestic aluminum prices have more than compensated for these expenses. The US Midwest premium has surged 113% since early June 2025, reflecting declining inventories and imports. The company expects tariff costs to rise further in Q4 but notes that rising prices support the US aluminum industry.

title: LME aluminium rises to USD 2,865/t and the inventories dip
summary: London Metal Exchange aluminum prices increased to $2,865 per tonne, with inventories showing a decline. Alumina prices slightly decreased by 0.4% to $312.26 per tonne. The market reflects ongoing supply tightening amid fluctuating demand.

title: LME aluminium rises to USD 2,865/t and the inventories dip
summary: On December 5, the London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminium price slightly increased to USD 2,865 per tonne amid falling stocks and warrants. Alumina prices softened, indicating subtle shifts in the market, while inventories dipped by 2,600 tonnes.

title: Aluminum Rebounds from 1-Month Low
summary: Aluminum futures rebounded above $2,850 per tonne after hitting a near one-month low, supported by macroeconomic tailwinds and stimulus signals from Beijing. China plans to slow aluminum output next year due to a 45 million ton cap, while supply disruptions continue globally, including a potline suspension in Iceland and refinery closure in Australia.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa Corp. reported that rising U.S. aluminum prices have more than offset the $69 million tariff costs incurred from import duties on Canadian aluminum. Despite tariffs doubling in 2025, higher domestic prices have helped the company maintain profitability, although tariff costs are expected to increase further in Q4.

title: SMM: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Drops on Dec 8
summary: According to SMM statistics, the release of production from new aluminum capacity is delayed, resulting in limited production growth in December. Secondary aluminum ingot social inventory has dropped, reflecting tighter supply conditions in the market.

title: World's first high-power aluminum-ion battery system for energy storage
summary: A complete aluminum-graphite-dual-ion battery system has been developed, offering a cost-effective and non-flammable energy storage solution. The aluminum-ion batteries demonstrate high energy and power densities, rapid charge-discharge capabilities, and long cycle life, potentially impacting aluminum demand in energy storage applications.

title: Novelis Wins German Ecodesign Award for Recycled Aluminium Automotive Sheet
summary: Novelis received the German Ecodesign Award for its production-ready aluminium alloy made with 100% recycled end-of-life automotive scrap. The alloy, Novelis Advanz™ 6F – e170RC, contains at least 75% recycled content and demonstrates the feasibility of true car-to-car aluminium recycling, significantly reducing CO₂ emissions by up to 95% compared to primary aluminium production.

title: ELYSIS Hits Milestone: First Inert Anode Aluminum Cell
summary: ELYSIS announced the successful start-up of its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at Rio Tinto's smelter in Alma, Québec, marking the first commercial-scale implementation of inert anode technology. This breakthrough enables large-scale, low-carbon aluminium production with no direct carbon emissions from smelting, improving worker safety and reducing costs.

title: Mercedes-Benz Partners with Norsk Hydro to Cut EV Emissions with Low-Carbon Aluminium
summary: Mercedes-Benz introduced low-carbon aluminium, developed with Norsk Hydro, into its new electric CLA model, reducing emissions by 40% compared to its predecessor. Norsk Hydro's aluminium production uses renewable energy and recycled scrap, emitting only 3 kg of CO₂ per kg of aluminium, significantly lower than the global average, supporting Mercedes' net-zero value chain goal by 2039.

title: Silicon, aluminum and lithium scarcity threaten green technology development
summary: A study highlights that scarcity and extraction challenges of critical raw materials like silicon, aluminum, and lithium could hinder green technology development essential for sustainability. The research calls for international cooperation and sustainable mining practices to mitigate supply risks and emphasizes enhancing recycling and reuse to reduce pressure on natural resources.

title: Aluminum giants hit major milestone with low-carbon production
summary: Elysis, a joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto, achieved a breakthrough in scaling its carbon-free inert anode technology for aluminium production. This innovation is a key step toward decarbonizing aluminium smelting by eliminating direct carbon emissions, reinforcing Canada's leadership in sustainable aluminium.

title: Iron Ore Prices Dip Amid China Slowdown
summary: Iron ore prices declined last week due to a seasonal slowdown in China's steel sector and rising supply pressure. Capacity utilization rates and daily hot metal production decreased, while shipments from Australia increased, leading to higher inventory levels at Chinese ports and downward pressure on steel market sentiment.

title: Steel rebar futures in China test highest level in three months amid government support
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose above CNY 3,100 per tonne in early December, reaching a three-month high due to lower supply and government measures to support the property market. Despite poor near-term demand, these factors helped offset weakness, with steel prices rising 1.65% over the past month but still down 5.68% year-on-year.

title: HRC Steel Hits 15-week High
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices increased to $857 per tonne, the highest since July 2025, marking a 5.28% gain over the past four weeks and a 23.69% rise over the last 12 months. This reflects a strengthening trend in steel prices despite some recent volatility.

title: China's Steel Surplus Isn't Easy to Tackle, Says Association
summary: The World Steel Association highlighted the difficulty in addressing China's steel overcapacity due to its deep integration with the domestic economy. The association forecasts a 2% decline in Chinese steel demand in 2025 and another 1% in 2026, with no short-term practical solutions to the surplus problem.

title: JSW Steel Share Price Live Updates
summary: JSW Steel's share price showed a consistent trading pattern, closing at Rs 1162.2 in the previous trading session. This reflects stable investor sentiment amid ongoing market developments in the steel sector.

title: US Steel to resume production at Illinois plant shut 3 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel announced it will resume steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, reopening the blast furnace idled three years ago amid strikes. The company plans to restart production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers, responding to strengthening demand and under pressure from the White House. This move follows Nippon Steel's $14.9 billion acquisition of U.S. Steel, which includes commitments to invest $14 billion in U.S. steel production.

title: US Steel to resume steel production at Illinois plant shut 2 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel is restarting steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, reversing its earlier decision to wind down operations. The blast furnace, idled two years ago due to strikes, will be restarted to meet rising customer demand, with production expected to resume in the first half of 2026. The company must hire 400 of the 500 workers needed to operate the plant, supported by a robust U.S. steel market bolstered by tariffs and increased automaking and construction activity.

title: China's Steel Surplus Isn't Easy to Tackle, Says Association
summary: The World Steel Association highlighted that China's steel overcapacity is deeply embedded in its economy, making it difficult to resolve quickly. Closing steel companies has significant ripple effects on the domestic economy, and there is no short-term practical solution to the surplus. This underscores the complexity of addressing global steel production imbalances.

title: World crude steel production down 5.9% in October 2025
summary: World crude steel production for 70 reporting countries was 143.3 million tonnes in October 2025, marking a 5.9% decrease compared to October 2024. Meanwhile, stainless steel melt shop production increased by 3.0% in the first nine months of 2025 compared to the same period in 2024, reflecting mixed trends in global steel production.

title: Steel plant to be built in Uganda with $500 million investment
summary: A new steel plant is planned for construction in Uganda with an investment of $500 million, signaling expansion in steel production capacity in Africa. This development is part of broader global steel market activities including production changes and trade adjustments in various countries.

title: Launch of the Clean Steel Partnership paves the way for further research and deployment of groundbreaking technology
summary: The Clean Steel Partnership aims to pilot and demonstrate breakthrough technologies to reduce CO2 emissions in the EU steel sector, targeting a 50% cut by 2027 compared to 1990 levels and achieving technology readiness level 8 by 2030. With an EU contribution of €700 million and private commitments up to €1 billion, the partnership supports the European Green Deal and the steel industry's transition to carbon neutrality by 2050.

title: AI Startup Deep.Meta Pushes UK Steel Toward Lower Emissions
summary: Deep.Meta's AI-driven simulations have achieved nearly a 10% emissions reduction at Spartan UK's steel plate production facility. The company is advancing its Deep.Optimiser PhyX system with support from the UK government's Manchester Prize, aiming to enhance energy efficiency and support net zero goals in the steel industry through AI-assisted optimization.

title: Molten Industries Leads Strategic Partnership with U. S. Steel and CPFD Software to Pioneer Carbon-Neutral Steel Production
summary: Molten Industries, U.S. Steel, and CPFD Software received a $5.4 million DOE grant to develop a project integrating methane-pyrolysis-driven hydrogen production with a pilot direct reduced iron furnace. This initiative aims to significantly reduce energy use, carbon intensity, and costs in steel production, potentially eliminating up to 60 million tons of CO2 emissions in U.S. steelmaking.

title: Steelmaking decarbonisation
summary: BHP highlights the challenges and opportunities in decarbonizing steelmaking, emphasizing multiple technology pathways supported by cheaper renewable energy and carbon capture infrastructure. The company is investing in projects to reduce greenhouse gas emissions intensity by 30% relative to conventional methods by 2030, supporting the global energy transition and rising steel demand.

title: New Australia–China agreement launches joint steel decarbonisation effort
summary: Australia and China have signed a memorandum of understanding to support ongoing discussions aimed at reducing emissions across the iron and steel value chains. The initiative focuses on pathways to lower-emissions steel production, evolving markets for decarbonised steel, and policy cooperation, recognizing steel and ironmaking contribute up to 9% of global emissions.

title: Copper Prices Surge to Record High
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange (LME) soared, closing 1.5% higher at $11,620.50 a tonne on Friday, reaching a record high of $11,705 a tonne earlier in the day. The surge is driven by bullish forecasts from Citi analysts who predict a potential shortage due to increased stockpiling in the US and expect copper to average $13,000 a tonne in Q2 2026.

title: Copper price extends record run as Citi makes bullish call
summary: Copper futures on the LME rose as much as 2.2% to $11,705 a ton, surpassing the previous record high. Citi analysts forecast a global copper deficit driven by US stockpiling ahead of potential tariffs, pushing prices to $13,000 a ton in Q2 2026. Despite high inventory levels, the market anticipates volatility and a supply crunch.

title: Copper Trades Near Record as US Stockpiling Spurs Supply Crunch
summary: Copper edged up 0.2% to $11,639.50 a ton on the LME, trading near an all-time high after setting a record of $11,705 a ton. The rally is fueled by US stockpiling and tight global supply, with Citi analysts' bullish outlook reinforcing expectations of a supply-demand imbalance and raw material shortages.

title: DRC state-owned enterprise Gecamines cooperates with Mercuria, LME copper surged significantly last Friday
summary: LME copper futures opened at $11,609/mt last Friday and closed at $11,665/mt, up 2.02%, showing a 'W' pattern in early trading. Spot prices in Shanghai remained stable with premiums unchanged, while recycled copper raw material prices rose 200 yuan/mt month-over-month. The cooperation between Gecamines and Mercuria is part of market dynamics influencing copper prices.

title: China's copper imports decline in November amid surging prices
summary: China's copper imports fell 2.51% in November to 427,000 metric tons due to rising prices. Despite this, copper prices on the LME reached an all-time peak of $11,210.50 a ton in November and broke through that level in December amid supply concerns. Chinese smelters plan to cut output by 10% in 2026, which may tighten refined copper supply further.

title: Silver, copper eclipse gold as top metals bets on supply fears
summary: Copper prices remain structurally bullish with limited downside due to supply fears. Traders and analysts highlight copper's strong fundamentals amid concerns about supply constraints, which have driven copper and silver to outperform gold recently.

title: DRC state-owned enterprise Gecamines cooperates with Mercuria, LME copper surged significantly last Friday
summary: LME copper futures opened at $11,609/mt last Friday and closed at $11,665/mt, up 2.02%, showing a volatile 'W' pattern. Shanghai spot copper premiums remain persistent amid tight supply, while imported and secondary copper prices showed mixed movements. The cooperation between DRC's Gecamines and Mercuria is part of the market dynamics influencing copper supply and pricing.

title: Copper trades near record as US stockpiling spurs supply crunch
summary: Copper prices are near all-time highs driven by US stockpiling and tight global supply, fueling investor bets on a sustained rally. The market is characterized by a supply-demand imbalance and a global shortage of raw materials, contributing to the price surge.

title: Copper Prices Surge to Record High
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange reached a record high of $11,705 a tonne, closing 1.5% higher at $11,620.50. The surge is driven by bullish forecasts from Citi analysts who expect a shortage due to increased US stockpiling and anticipate copper averaging $13,000 a tonne in Q2 2026. The rally is supported by rising global consumption and concerns over metal inventory depletion outside the US.

title: Copper Trades Near Record as US Stockpiling Spurs Supply Crunch
summary: Copper traded near an all-time high after hitting a record $11,705 a ton, with momentum fueled by Citigroup analysts' bullish outlook. The market faces a supply-demand imbalance and global raw material shortages, intensified by US stockpiling efforts.

title: Column: Will the real Doctor Copper please step forward?
summary: Copper prices are surging with record highs on London and Shanghai markets amid a complex market fracture rather than a simple supply crunch. LME copper stocks have been heavily drawn down, likely destined for the US due to import tariff threats, causing a split between US and global markets. Producers like Codelco have raised premiums significantly, reflecting tightness in supply and shifting inventory dynamics.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto has successfully produced its first copper from the Johnson Camp mine in Arizona using its Nuton technology, marking a significant milestone in copper production innovation.

title: True North tops up the coffers to back growth programs
summary: True North Copper is raising $12.5 million to accelerate development at its Mount Oxide project and the emerging Aquila discovery, supporting growth in copper production capacity.

title: Copper industry seeks curb on cheap imports
summary: With India's copper production reaching new heights, local manufacturers are urging the government to restrict cheap imports to protect domestic capacity and market stability.

title: Global Copper Supply Crunch Threatens Market Stability in 2025
summary: The global copper supply crunch is causing market fragmentation, driving record premiums, and reshaping investment strategies as supply tightness intensifies worldwide.

title: Rewiring a sustainable, clean energy future with copper
summary: The article highlights copper’s critical role in the clean energy transition, noting that demand for copper in clean energy could nearly double by 2050. It emphasizes copper’s recyclability—nearly 80% of all mined copper is still in use—and how responsible mining, recycling, and innovation are key to a sustainable, net-zero future.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper Cathode at Johnson Camp Mine
summary: Rio Tinto’s Nuton technology has produced its first copper cathode at the Gunnison Copper project using a novel sulphide bioleaching process. The technology promises up to 80% less water use and up to 60% lower carbon emissions than conventional processing, with a projected mine-to-metal footprint of just 0.82 kg CO₂-e per kg of copper.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton tech makes first-ever copper cathode at Gunnison mine
summary: Rio Tinto’s Nuton technology has successfully produced the first copper cathode at the Gunnison (Johnson Camp) mine using a unique sulphide bioleaching method. The breakthrough enables cleaner, faster copper production with significantly reduced water and carbon intensity, cutting out traditional steps like milling, smelting, and refining.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto reports that its Nuton technology has produced its first copper cathode at the Johnson Camp Mine, marking a breakthrough in cleaner copper production. The technology shortens the supply chain by eliminating concentration, smelting, and refining, while targeting up to 80% less water use and up to 60% lower carbon emissions.

title: AI Data Centers Could Consume Half a Million Tons of Copper Annually by 2030
summary: The article discusses how rapidly expanding AI data centers could drive massive copper demand, potentially consuming half a million tons annually by 2030. This underscores the growing importance of copper in digital infrastructure and the need for sustainable, innovative supply solutions.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low due to a pessimistic outlook from the Federal Reserve, which outweighed potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Futures on the London Metal Exchange fell as much as 2.3%, with nickel trending about 8% lower this year amid new supply expectations and slowing electric vehicle sales.

title: Nickel Price Collapse Forces Market Repricing as Oversupply & Weak Demand Challenge Producers
summary: Nickel prices have collapsed to approximately US$15,000 per tonne, down 10% year-over-year, with 32% of production offline due to severe margin stress. Oversupply persists with a forecasted 198,000t surplus in 2025 and record-high inventories, despite Indonesian output remaining resilient amid government quota restrictions. Trade tariffs and geopolitical factors are causing supply chain realignment, creating distinct pricing mechanisms based on source jurisdiction.

title: The Monday Report - 08 December 2025
summary: Nickel prices showed a slight increase, rising 0.27% to $6.68 per pound as part of a broader rise in base metals including copper and aluminum. The report highlights ongoing market movements and commodity price trends over the past week, with nickel maintaining modest gains despite broader market volatility.

title: LME nickel price rebounds above $14,900 on weak US dollar expectations
summary: Nickel futures on the London Metal Exchange rebounded above $14,900 per tonne, reaching a one-week high driven by expectations of a weaker US dollar. This rebound reflects short-term market fluctuations amid broader price volatility in nickel.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Fluctuate Rangebound on December 8, Central Bank Increases Gold Holdings for 13th Consecutive Month
summary: Nickel prices remained rangebound with minor fluctuations on December 8, reflecting cautious market sentiment. The report also notes China's central bank increased gold reserves for the 13th consecutive month, indicating ongoing strategic commodity positioning.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia’s Nornickel, one of the world’s largest nickel producers, maintained its 2025 nickel production forecast at 196,000-204,000 metric tons. The company reported an 18% increase in nickel production to 54,000 metric tons in Q3 2025, attributing the rise to higher volumes of processed raw materials accumulated in Q2. However, production was affected earlier in the year by a transition to new mining equipment and seasonal port flooding.

title: PE eyes BHP's Nickel West as China tightens rare earth grip
summary: Private equity investors are showing renewed interest in BHP's Nickel West amid China's tightening control over rare earth exports and nickel production. Nickel prices have dropped 50% over three years due to increased low-cost Indonesian production, much under Chinese ownership. Strategic moves by Japanese firms and U.S. investors aim to diversify supply chains and capitalize on nickel's growing role in electric vehicle batteries.

title: Market Watch: Monday 8th December, 2025
summary: The pre-feasibility study for the Gonneville palladium-nickel-copper deposit in Western Australia, owned by Chalice Mining, indicates a capital requirement of $820 million for development. The project has a post-tax net present value of $1 billion, highlighting significant investment interest in nickel-related assets in the region.

title: Critical Minerals Gap Widens As U.S. Delays Key Decisions
summary: Executives from U.S. critical minerals companies urge faster government action to support nickel and other critical mineral projects to counter China's dominance. They recommend a comprehensive minerals plan, pressure on Indonesia to limit nickel production (which accounts for 60% of global supply), and expedited financing approvals. The surge in Indonesian nickel output has depressed prices by nearly 50%, challenging U.S. projects like Westwin Elements’ nickel refinery.

title: US minerals projects seek 'industrial vision' from Washington to compete with China
summary: At the Reuters NEXT conference, U.S. critical minerals executives called for a unified industrial strategy to build supply chains for nickel and other key minerals. They emphasized the need to pressure Indonesia to reduce nickel output, which has flooded the market and lowered prices by half. The call includes speeding up loan approvals and integrating supply chain inputs to support domestic nickel refining and mining projects.

title: SPC Nickel sets clear 2026 exploration strategy
summary: SPC Nickel is advancing its 2026 exploration plans following promising 2025 field results at the Muskox Project in Canada. The company is analyzing geophysics data and continuing drilling at Muskox and Lockerby East projects, targeting nickel, copper, and platinum group metals. Recent samples show high copper equivalents, indicating strong mineralization over large areas, supporting the company’s optimistic outlook.

title: Nickel at a crossroads: conform or reform
summary: The global nickel market is undergoing a significant shift toward sustainability with strategic investments in refining, recycling, and low-carbon mining. The U.S. government supports domestic nickel supply resilience through funding and policy measures, while companies like Redwood Materials lead in recycling nickel from lithium-ion batteries to reduce import dependence and environmental impact.

title: FPX Nickel Joins Mining Association of Canada and UN Global Compact
summary: FPX Nickel has strengthened its sustainability leadership by joining the Mining Association of Canada and signing onto the UN Global Compact. These steps reinforce its commitment to responsible mineral exploration and development, aligning operations with global principles on human rights, labor, environment, and anti-corruption while advancing the Baptiste Nickel Project.

title: Momentum Technologies CEO Testifies Before Congress on Critical Minerals Processing Solutions to Strengthen American Energy Independence
summary: Momentum Technologies demonstrated advanced processing capabilities for critical minerals including nickel at its Texas facility. The company advocates for government support to develop modular processing sites to reduce dependence on foreign sources and enhance domestic supply resilience, emphasizing sustainable and scalable technology for nickel and other battery materials.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary
summary: NOVONIX's patented all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology is expected to reduce costs and environmental impacts of nickel-based cathode production. The blog discusses nickel's sustainability potential across its lifecycle and highlights the importance of industry responsibility to ensure nickel remains a sustainable material for electric vehicles and clean energy technologies.

title: Critical minerals – new partnerships needed to build fair value chains
summary: UNCTAD emphasizes the need for new partnerships to build fair and sustainable value chains for critical minerals like nickel. The organization outlines four pillars—technical, financial, commercial, and institutional—to support responsible investment, industrial capacity building, and governance improvements that will enhance sustainability in nickel supply chains.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a 200 million euro capital increase to support growth and acquisitions, including the acquisition of Special Melted Products (SMP) in the UK. This move strengthens Cogne's position in the stainless steel long products market and aligns with its growth strategy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has finalized the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from Salzgitter for approximately EUR 135 million. This acquisition expands Cogne's product portfolio to include seamless stainless steel and nickel alloy tubes, enhancing its competitiveness in the European market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: The ADVANT Alliance advises Cogne Acciai Speciali on the acquisition of leading seamless tube manufacturer Mannesmann Stainless Tubes
summary: The ADVANT Alliance provided legal advisory services to Cogne Acciai Speciali on its cross-border acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH. This strategic acquisition strengthens Cogne's position in Europe as a single-source provider of stainless steel and nickel alloy solutions.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and reports a high rate of permanent employment contracts.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched a green hydrogen pilot plant powered by hydropower and rooftop solar panels. The initiative aims to reduce carbon emissions by up to 26 tons, supporting the company's sustainability goals in steel production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne initiates another three-month temporary layoffs round
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has notified trade unions about implementing a second temporary layoff scheme this year, reflecting ongoing adjustments in its workforce management amid market conditions.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris has acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, enhancing Tenaris's capabilities in offshore markets and allowing anti-corrosion coatings to be applied at its facilities in Italy and other countries.

title: Tenaris Completes First Tranche of USD600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris completed the first $600 million tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, purchasing over 33 million shares representing 3.08% of its issued share capital. The shares bought will be canceled over time, reflecting Tenaris's financial strength and commitment to enhancing shareholder value.

title: Prysmian Group invests €350 million in new cable-laying vessels and expands submarine cable production capacity
summary: Prysmian Group announced a €350 million investment to add two advanced cable-laying vessels to its fleet, enhancing its submarine project execution capabilities. The company is also expanding production capacity at its plants in Finland and Italy, including a €100 million investment in the Arco Felice plant in Italy, to meet growing demand for submarine cables driven by energy transition and grid upgrades.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian SpA raised its full-year 2025 guidance following better-than-expected Q3 revenue and earnings, driven by strong performance in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments. The company reported a 3% revenue increase to €5.03 billion in Q3, with significant organic growth in transmission cables, including copper cables, supporting its positive outlook.

title: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex Announce Solar + Storage Behind-the-Meter Project for Prysmian Manufacturing
summary: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex have launched a solar plus storage project behind the meter for Prysmian's manufacturing operations, supporting sustainable energy use at Prysmian facilities. This initiative aligns with Prysmian's broader commitment to energy transition and electrification.
